Title:
SENIOR MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER - Remote 100% (Spain or The UK based)
SENIOR MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER - Remote 100% (Spain or The UK based)
Job Description:
"About the job
Join Our Team as a  Senior Machine Learning Engineer - 40 hours/week

Are you ready to be part of a dynamic cybersecurity scale-up revolutionizing secure software development? At IriusRisk, we're on a mission to make Secure by Design the standard practice for software teams everywhere. With our platform automating threat modeling, we empower developers to create secure software at scale.

About Us

IriusRisk is the world’s leading automated threat modeling tool (*our grandma says so). Born out of a desire to advance threat modeling as an activity and ensure that software is secure from the design stage. IriusRisk helps the largest banks and technology providers build their software. Yep, that’s right, the team builds the tools that build the world’s software.

A scale-up with large enterprise clients that retains a fast-paced, agile, get-things-done, start-up mentality. A place where everyone’s ideas are welcomed, valued, and challenged, meaning the entire team has the opportunity to change how software is built securely at the very largest scale. We also love a meme.

Purpose of the Role

Join us at the forefront of AI integration in cybersecurity! We're seeking a Senior ML Engineer to enhance our platform with cutting-edge AI capabilities. In this role, you'll drive the development of server-side logic and infrastructure to elevate our threat modeling experience. Collaborating closely with AI engineers, you'll pioneer new product features, ensuring scalability, security, and performance.

Duties & Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deliver backend solutions for AI integration within the IriusRisk Threat Modeling platform.
Collaborate with AI engineers to deploy innovative product enhancements.
Stay informed about the latest backend technologies, evaluating their potential application in our development process.
Contribute to technical roadmap and architectural decisions for backend development.

About You

We're seeking a proactive problem-solver with a keen eye for detail. As an excellent communicator, you thrive in collaborative environments and engage effectively with team members and stakeholders. With a passion for continuous learning, you stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends.

If you're ready to shape the future of secure software development with AI, we want to hear from you! Join us in our mission to make the digital world safer for all. Apply now to become a vital part of the IriusRisk team!

What we are offering?

100% remote work!
Flexible hours and ease of work/family balance
Great team collaboration between departments.
An Agile environment!
We have a “Do it well” culture and we don’t fear investing time to do things right the first time while balancing time to delivery.
Training budget and certifications related to your role.
Medical Insurance
Referral bonus
Horizontal business culture
4,5* Glassdoor rating
+92% employee retention rate

Requirements:

Essential Skills And Experience

A strong and pragmatic product focus that means you get working solutions into the hands of users quickly and iteratively.
Experience developing a product from design to delivery, with time-to-market and user experience is a priority.
Strong opinions on what a good engineering culture looks like, and a drive for continuous improvement.
Solid experience developing with Python, FastAPI, and similar technologies.
Experience with API-first development and the HATEOAS architecture for REST API development.
Strong background in scalable and distributed architectures such as microservices, containers etc.
Experience building services in AWS, using native AWS services, and developing and deploying Infrastructure as Code.
Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.

Nice to have

Exposure to AI, LLM, machine learning, and NLP libraries (e.g., LangChain, TensorFlow, PyTorch, spaCy).
Previous use of Amazon Web Services tools around AI/ML (Bedrock, SageMaker, …).
Experience working directly with data scientists and AI engineers.
Experience with cybersecurity or threat modeling is a significant plus.
Experience with leading a team of software engineers."

Title:
Machine Learning Engineer
Machine Learning Engineer
Job Description:
"About the job
Amsterdam or Vilvoorde: 

 Are you interested in working with ML models within the domain of digital advertising for well-known brands with millions of viewers per day? Then read on!
  Who are we
 The Advertising Data BENE team consists of 15 colleagues (development team of 10 and 5 business profiles) and is responsible for advertising data, AI/MLE & generative AI solutions within the domain of digital advertising. You will have daily contact with Product & Innovation teams, Developers and of course your teammates themselves. You will end up in the Advertising Data BENE team, which is part of the central Digital Sales Development department. From our office in Amsterdam or Vilvoorde you will end up in an energetic environment that is in full development.
  What will you do?

In the role of ML Engineer you are responsible for the end-to-end implementation of ML models within the domain of digital advertising. You also build and maintain data pipelines & contribute to our web applications.
Example ML models, data pipelines & web applications in the advertising domain:

Client’s Datalab - self-service application for advertisers to create audiences for targeted advertising (similar to Facebook Business Manager)
Models that predict which advertising banner/creative is most suitable for an online visitor
Predictive models for most likely converters/clickers of advertising campaigns
Predictive models for predicting age and gender of the client’ online visitors based on consumed content
Adding profile enrichments in batch & real-time flows in a big data environment
Data pipelines & dashboards for quality monitoring & alerting

 Tasks

You will strengthen our scrum team consisting of Product Owner, Scrum Master & 8 developers.
you participate in standups, refinements, retros & demos (2 weeks)
you build it, you run it mentality (development & devops, infrastructure-as-code, CICD, ...)
you analyze requirements, experiment with different models, substantiate your choices using quality parameters, implement & present results to the dev & business team
you help build our underlying data stack & data pipelines (python, PySpark, ElasticSearch, Terraform, Airflow,..)
You will develop our ML Ops platform together with the Data & ML engineers
you integrate our services with other teams that use our data services
you take ownership & accountability for certain models, jobs & applications
20% of the time working on features and models, 80% is building the data stack, web applications & incremental improvements

 We offer

Market-conform salary depending on knowledge and work experience
Travel expenses reimbursement;
A challenging position based on 36 hours, where you will have plenty of room to build and add value for our client 
8% holiday allowance and 4% personal budget, which can be spent at your own discretion;
Annual profit sharing based on the performance of our client 
Room for development through training courses and other educational opportunities.

 What makes you the perfect candidate?

You are a solid software engineer with ideally several years of experience as an ML Engineer
You have at least 1 year of experience with AWS Stack, Python, (Py)Spark, Terraform and Airflow
You have hands-on experience with ML Ops & ML frameworks (fe SKlearn) for training, monitoring, deploying features & models
Experience with Java & Spring is a plus
You are thorough but pragmatic with an eye for quality & testing
You are not afraid to find your way in a complex business domain with many stakeholders to understand requirements & tackle complex problems
Depending on your location, you will work in Amsterdam (NL) or Vilvoorde (BE). Once a month you will travel across the border for team meetings.
Mastery of the Dutch language is a must."

Title:
Machine Learning Engineer
Machine Learning Engineer with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Are you ready to apply Data, ML & GenAI technology to create meaningful impact with digital products at scale, solve the needs of its users and tackle real-world problems in the world of digital & business? Are you up for the challenge to scale AI applications to hundred thousands of users, balancing best engineering practices and continuous user feedback? Then the role of a Senior Machine Learning Engineer will definitely trigger your interest! 

In The Pocket's mission is to create digital products that make people happy and businesses grow. We believe both aspects are crucial for successful digital products, and they will often drive one another. Generative AI, Machine Learning & Data technologies allow us to improve both: by improving the experience of existing products, by enabling new business models based on newly uncovered insights and by enabling a whole range of new digital products with new value streams. Let's leverage ML & data to build even better digital products.

🚀What you’ll do:

You'll closely collaborate with ML Engineers, Product Managers, Architects, and Software Engineers to define, implement and improve use cases that are enabled through machine learning. You are responsible for the life-cycle of the AI solution. This includes designing, developing testing, improving deploying and scaling the model that is used. There will be a focus on MLOps and the ability to scale modern NLP applications both in amount of users and data. But you don't do this in a vacuum. Rather, you're part of a multidisciplinary team where every member is equally responsible for the product's success.
You keep up with the latest Data, Machine Learning & Generative AI advances, with a particular focus on what might be applicable in our context. In particular, your enthusiasm for ""what is possible"" motivates you and we expect you to transfer that enthusiasm to your team members and even our clients.
You actively participate in knowledge sharing both towards peers (lessons learned, new advances, process improvements,..) as well as other people in our organisation (e.g. sales, marketing, product, strategy...). And it doesn't have to stop there: we happily support any initiatives to share our findings with the world, through blogs, talks, podcasts or guest lectures.
You clearly communicate and set expectations. What realistic results can be expected? What are the greatest risks/unknowns? Always be open and honest, and don't be afraid to ask for help.


🐱‍🚀Who you are:

Educational Background: Hold a bachelor/master/PhD degree in Computer Science or related fields, with a master's in Data Science, AI, Statistics, or Machine Learning, or have a proven track record in a similar role.
Technical Proficiency: Possess profound knowledge of Python and at least one major machine learning framework (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch) and AI platforms like Huggingface, replicate, or cloud services like Vertex AI Studio, AWS Sagemaker, or Azure AI Studio.
Production Experience: Have experience in moving beyond local ML experiments to production, including MLOps, data versioning, and LLM orchestration frameworks.
Broad Awareness: Understand the possibilities and limitations of ML and see how Data and ML can help build better products for clients.
Product Design Affinity: Have a strong affinity for designing and engineering top-notch digital products.
Clean Code Advocate: Value clean code principles, continuous improvement, and rapid prototyping. Experience with continuous delivery and/or DevOps practices is a plus.
Cloud Services Knowledge: Familiarity with broader services from Google Cloud Platform, AWS, or Azure is a plus.
Knowledge Sharing Enthusiast: Excel in sharing knowledge with others and enjoy coaching team members to deepen their expertise.


Additional information:

Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. We rely on trust and openness, and sharing our learning curve. At In The Pocket, there’s time to experiment and budget to develop yourself. 

On a personal level, we’re looking for someone who shares our values:

Ownership: Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. You take ownership and show the ability to decide and act for the good of the company.
Integrity: Stick to your values, even when it doesn’t pay off in the short term. In The Pocket relies on trust and openness, which in turn relies on your integrity.
Lead & Educate: Digital technologies are changing the world. We go all in, head-first. We take the lead in designing and building with emerging technologies. We share our passion and knowledge with as many people as possible.
Agility: In The Pocket is permanently under construction. We never settle, it’s never done. Observing, adapting and improving is in our nature. That resonates with the people who work here. We are always looking for a better solution, always ready for the next step, pragmatic and committed to moving forward.
Team: As individuals, we are bright and talented, as a team we are unbeatable. We are open and positive, constructive and honest. We help and inspire our colleagues to do their best work.


Apply now! If this sounds like the challenge you’ve been waiting for, we’d love to hear from you!"

Machine Learning Engineer, Trilogy (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
Machine Learning Engineer, Trilogy (Remote) - $100,000/year USD with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

Ready to leverage your mastery of LLMs to drive productivity? At Trilogy, we're opening doors to an exceptional tech career, welcoming those who've honed their AI skills to elevate their expertise in a dynamic environment. We're offering a rare chance where your primary focus will be to further expand your proficiency in LLMs.

In an industry often filled with more buzzwords than tangible progress, Trilogy stands out as a hub of genuine innovation. Our focus is on practical, real-world applications aimed at reshaping industries. Imagine creating AI-driven tools that streamline workflow, automate tasks, or enhance decision-making processes, all to significantly boost productivity.

Your mandate? Harnessing LLMs to revolutionize how businesses operate, improving efficiency and effectiveness. You'll be architecting solutions that integrate AI seamlessly, making intricate processes more accessible and refining workflows for maximum output. Here, you won't be lost in bureaucratic hurdles or pitching ideas into the void. Instead, you'll witness the direct impact of your efforts, as your work directly influences the evolution of productivity tools.

Ready to unleash your expertise and become a force of change? Let's explore if you're the catalyst we're seeking for this exciting opportunity!

What You Will Be Doing

Designing and building high-quality AI automations to streamline processes, enhance productivity, and deliver robust, scalable solutions across diverse applications
Experimenting with state-of-the-art AI tools like GPT-4 Vision and Amazon CodeWhisperer, integrating them into our developmental process to assess and enhance their utility
Evaluating and optimizing the implementation of AI solutions across various infrastructures, including AWS, to ensure seamless performance and integration

What You Won’t Be Doing

Traditional coding - our AI does the heavy lifting, freeing you to innovate and strategize
Being stuck on repetitive tasks - no two problems are the same

Machine Learning Engineer Key Responsibilities

Architecting and deploying sophisticated, fully-automated AI systems that require zero human intervention for a truly scalable impact

Basic Requirements

Professional experience leveraging LLMs, such as ChatGPT, Bing, Bard, or Claude, to automate manual tasks and boost your company's productivity
At least 2 years of professional work experience
Proficiency in Python and API integration
Proficiency in AWS

About Trilogy

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Crossover Job Code: LJ-5105-EE-Tallinn-MachineLearnin.010"

Proficiency
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Straight from the Devs

Title:
Sr. Machine Learning Engineer - IBP
Sr. Machine Learning Engineer - IBP with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Overview

About Pepsico

PepsiCo is a global food and beverage leader with a product portfolio including 22 brands that generate more than $1 billion each in annual retail sales. Our main businesses – Quaker, Tropicana, Gatorade, Frito-Lay and Pepsi-Cola – make hundreds of enjoyable foods and beverages that are loved throughout the world.

At PepsiCo, you get the best of both worlds: an entrepreneur’s mindset plus reach and resources. Our collaborative culture and worldwide presence generate a stream of new opportunities to define the future and propel your life’s work. Bring your unique perspective. Bring curiosity. Bring ingenuity, and drive. We’ll give you a platform to be daring on a global scale.

About Data & Analytics

With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data that allows PepsiCo’s leaders to solve their problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.

Job Description

Your role will be to be part of growing team based in Barcelona, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo with the focus on creating high quality demand forecasts, demand decomposition metric and new product forecasting as specified in the PepsiCo’s Integrated Business Planning program.

You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase and putting them in production as a part of the PepsiCo forecasting engine solution. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments

You will be an internal ambassador of the team’s culture around data and analytics. You will provide stewardship to colleagues in the areas that you are an expert in or you are specializing.

Responsibilities

This Role Will Support The Following Activities

Active contributor to code development in projects and services, leading other ML Engineers and data scientists and coaching them on best methods for feature engineering, data processing scalability and model deployment.

Act as contributor in innovation activities

Work with data scientists, IBP process leads and BU subject matter experts to help identify incoming data clusters to achieve maximum forecasting performance metrics (high accuracy, low bias and good trend shapes)

Partner with data scientist working on discovery, prototypes and pilot. Focus on experiment tracking.translating business operation models to ML/statistical models and model ready analytical data sets (MRD)

Partner with the IBP market deploy and sustain teams (in the same IBP DS organization) to design, implement and test pre-processing and post-processing modules to improve demand forecasts.

Partner with data engineers to ensure data access for discovery and proper data is prepared for model consumption.
Partner with ML engineers and data scientists working on industrialization.
Occasionally, coordinate work activities with Business teams, other IT services and as required.
Drive the use of the Platform toolset and to also focus on 'the art of the possible' demonstrations to the business as needed.
Communicate with business stakeholders in the process of service design, training and knowledge transfer.
Support large-scale experimentation and build data-driven models.
Research in state-of-the-art methodologies and techniques for feature engineering, model data preprocessing and performance of the pipelines to accommodate service level agreements for multiple markets. 
Refine requirements into modelling problems.
Influence product teams through data-based recommendations.
Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.
Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.
Create in a reliable way reusable packages or libraries.

Qualifications

4+ years’ experience building solutions in the revenue management or in the supply chain space.
4+ years working in a team to deliver production level analytic solutions. Fluent in git (version control) and with Docker.
4+ years’ experience in ETL and/or data wrangling techniques. Fluent in SQL syntaxis.
4+ years’ experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems. Experiences with Deep Learning are a plus.
3+ years’ experience in developing business problem related statistical/ML modeling with industry tools with primary focus on Python or Scala development.
Business storytelling and communicating data insights in business consumable format. Fluent in one Visualization tool.
Strong communications and organizational skills with the ability to deal with ambiguity while juggling multiple priorities
Experience with Agile methodology for team work and analytics ‘product’ creation. Fluent in Jira, Confluence.
Experience with Azure cloud services is essential.
Experience in Reinforcement Learning is a plus.
Experience in Simulation and Optimization problems in any space is a plus.
Experience with Bayesian methods is a plus.
Experience with Causal inference is a plus.
Experience with NLP is a plus.
Experience with working with FAIR data is a plus.
Experience with Responsible AI is a plus.
Experience with distributed machine learning is a plus"

Title:
Machine Learning Engineer | Bright Cubes
Machine Learning Engineer | Bright Cubes
Job Description:
"About the job
Wat ga jij doen?

Op zoek naar een uitdagende rol als Machine Learning Engineer? Bij Bright Cubes kun je je passie voor Machine Learning omzetten in concrete resultaten. We zoeken een getalenteerde Engineer die data en IT in de kern heeft zitten.

Wie ben jij?

Jij Bent Een Topper In Data Met Een Hart Voor IT. Als Gezellige Collega Leer Je Graag Van Anderen En Sta Je Open Voor Nieuwe Kennis. Bij Bright Cubes Krijg Je Projecten Die Aansluiten Bij Jouw Ambitie En Ervaring, Want Innovatieve Uitdagingen Zijn Voor De Echte Toppers. Onze Data Solutions Ontwikkelen We In Samenwerking Met Klanten, En Elk Project Is Uniek. Als Machine Learning Engineer Ga Je Aan De Slag Met Het Ontwikkelen Van Modellen En Zorg Je Ervoor Dat Ze Succesvol In Productie Worden Genomen. Jouw Taken Omvatten Onder Andere

Het ontwikkelen van Machine Learning modellen. 
De technische implementatie van de oplossing. 
Adviseren van de klant gedurende het project. 
Het organiseren van kennissessies. 


Bij Bright Cubes krijg je de kans om jezelf te ontplooien in een dynamische omgeving en te werken aan innovatieve projecten. Solliciteer nu en bouw mee aan onze succesvolle data-driven oplossingen!

Waar kom je te werken?

Bright Minds create Cubed Solutions Sinds 2016 is Bright Cubes een “kennisthuis” voor leergierige en ambitieuze IT-consultants, onze Bright Minds. Als een van de eersten en een van de weinigen zien wij het belang van integratie van cloud, software, data en security als één ecosysteem. Al onze Bright Minds behoren tot de besten in hun vakgebied en hebben daarnaast ook nog een sterke visie en ervaring in onze andere vakgebieden. Als Bright Mind kun je je dus ontwikkelen vanuit je eigen vakgebied naar meerdere vakgebieden en dat is uniek!

Wij werken voor de top 150 bedrijven van Nederland, daar waar geïnnoveerd wordt met cloud, security, software en data. Wij werken met passie en creativiteit aan innovatie Cubed Solutions, waarmee wij voor onze opdrachtgevers IT-ecosystemen creëren die waarde toevoegen en organisaties helpen te versnellen in een veranderende wereld. Wij Engineeren Digital Excellence.

Wat wij vragen?

Je Hebt Een Afgeronde Technische HBO- Of WO-opleiding, Bij Voorkeur Informatica, Wiskunde, Natuurkunde Of Econometrie. Daarnaast Heb Je Minimaal 3 Jaar Professionele Ervaring In Onderstaande Of Vergelijkbare Technologieën

Programmeertalen: Python, R 
Machine Learning frameworks: Keras, XGBoost, LightGBM, TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn 
Data preprocessing: Pandas, NumPy 
Cloud platforms: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud 
Model deployment: Docker, Kubernetes 
Data visualization: Matplotlib, Seaborn 
Model monitoring: TensorBoard, MLflow 
Hyperparameter tuning: Grid Search, Random Search 
Natural Language Processing (NLP): NLTK, spaCy 
Reinforcement Learning: OpenAI Gym 
Time Series Analysis: Prophet, ARIMA 
Model Explainability: SHAP, LIME 


Wat wij bieden?

Een competitief salaris dat meegroeit met je kennis en expertise. 
Flexibele mobiliteitsregeling, met keuzevrijheid voor een leaseauto, OV-abonnement of mobiliteitsvergoeding. 
Toegang tot opleidingen, trainingen, coaching, een eigen labomgeving en het Bright Learning programma. 
Een collectieve pensioensregeling en aanvullende verzekeringen voor optimale zekerheid. 
Een budget voor een laptop naar keuze. 
Maandelijkse telefonievergoeding. 
De mogelijkheid om thuis of hybride te werken. 
Een maandelijkse thuiswerkvergoeding. 
Een senior manager als sparringpartner in je vakgebied. 
De kans om te werken aan innovatieve projecten met de nieuwste technologieën en methodologieën. 
Vrijheid en flexibiliteit om je eigen carrièrepad te bepalen. 
Op maat gemaakte opdrachten die aansluiten bij je ambitie. 
Mogelijkheden voor sport en vitaliteit met Bright Vitality. 
Bright Fun: de kans om deel te nemen aan leuke sociale activiteiten zoals BBQ's, uitjes, borrels, proeverijen, game-events en wat je graag wilt organiseren."

Title:
Data Engineer - Ops Spark Kafka Python H/F
Data Engineer - Ops Spark Kafka Python H/F
Job Description:
"About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Lancé en 2021, Team.is est une start-up de recrutement spécialisée dans la chasse et le recrutement de profils IT, Digital, Ingénierie & Supply Chain.

Team.is c'est avant tout une entreprise à taille humaine animée par la passion du recrutement !

Team.is possède l'expertise et l'énergie pour s'attaquer à n'importe quel défi. Mais nous ne sommes pas des robots du recrutement. Nous sommes des consultants qui vivent et respirent ce que nous faisons ! Nous sommes déterminés à réaliser le meilleur travail possible pour cultiver des relations durables avec nos candidats et nos clients.

En postulant à cette offre, vous aurez l'opportunité de rejoindre une entreprise prometteuse avec une forte diversité de projets. Il s'agit d'une société qui a créé une plate-forme de connectivité cellulaire offrant à l'industrie automobile une nouvelle façon de permettre et d'améliorer le fonctionnement de ses voitures connectées à l'échelle mondiale.

Fondée en 2021 par des entrepreneurs télécoms chevronnés et d'anciens cadres d'acteurs des télécoms, de l'IOT, de la voiture connectée et de la télématique, l'entreprise recherche pour compléter son équipe un Data Engineer / Ops (Spark, Kafka, Python) H/F.

Vos Missions Si Vous Les Acceptez

En tant que membre de leur équipe Data, vous serez responsable de la définition, du développement et de l'exploitation de nos pipelines de traitement des données. La finalité principale est l'amélioration de la visibilité et du contrôle en interne et pour nos partenaires.

Étant donné que notre organisation suit un modèle holacratique, vous aurez des opportunités de contribuer au-delà de cette description, soit en restant spécialisé sur les données (analyse des données, visualisation, etc.), soit en explorant d'autres domaines.

Aucune connaissance préalable des spécificités des télécommunications n'est requise. Vous recevrez une formation à ce sujet pendant le processus de développement.

Vos Principales Responsabilités Comprendront

 Conception et architecture
 Sélection des technologies à mettre en oeuvre
 Développement de pipelines de traitement des données
 Mise en oeuvre de l'intégration et du déploiement continus
 Rédaction de tests automatisés
 Exploitation des solutions

Avantages

Notre client étant organisé en Holacratie, vous aurez toute liberté de proposer le ou les roles que vous souhaiterez assumer afin de faire bénéficier au mieux l'équipe de votre expérience. Vous pourrez également développer de nouvelles compétences en choisissant d'autres roles.

L'entreprise propose du 100% télétravail, vous pourrez travailler de n'importe où en France.

Autres Avantages

 Entre 8 et 11 jours de RTT par an
 3000€ HT de budget d'installation pour vous équiper - ce budget inclu votre laptop (Fame.work ou Macbook Pro)
 57.20 € / mois de prime télétravail
 2 rassemblements d'une semaine par an quelque part en France avec toute l'équipe
 Possibilité de co-working

Et vous ?

Vous êtes un ingénieur de données expérimenté et adaptable qui a réussi à naviguer avec succès dans des lancements de production sous haute pression, en particulier avec de grands volumes de données. Vous possédez une pensée indépendante, des compétences de résolution proactive des problèmes et une attitude positive. Vous êtes à la recherche de nouveaux défis techniques et êtes ouvert à explorer des approches non conventionnelles dans votre travail. Vous parlez français et vous êtes à l'aise en anglais. Compétences techniques

 Spark
 Kafka
 Python
 Delta Lake
 Grafana
 GCP
 Kubernetes
 ArgoCD & CrossPlane
 GitHub"

Title:
AI Engineer
AI Engineer
Job Description:
"About the job
At Silo AI engineers and researchers collaborate closely to tackle challenging real-world problems. We're seeking AI engineers with the ability to build robust and scalable production systems, quickly obtain a deep technical understanding of new domains, and solve the most important problems in large teams. We value experience with high-performance machine learning or scientific computing systems, as well as distributed systems and large-scale systems and data management.

What will you be doing

As an AI Engineer, you'll work in a group of AI-driven product engineers, developing both Silo AI's internal products and client solutions. You will collaborate with ML experts, and learn about solving real-life cases using the latest ML techniques. You may choose to work from our offices in Helsinki , Stockholm or any other office, whichever suits you best.

The responsibilities and tasks cover in particular:

Building, setting up and managing the AI infrastructure (library, workspace and deployment).
Deploying AI models into production.
Creating APIs and helping customers benefiting from AI models in operations.
Creating UIs for customers.
Helping AI Scientists understand the potential and limitations of the infrastructure when planning new projects.

Read more about the projects that we have worked on for Finnair in flight delay prediction, Ramboll in water quality predictions, and for Awake.AI in developing smart ports and smart vessels.

Our culture

What we believe in at Silo

Build Bonds - Trust is our bond. We connect with customers and always seek to understand how we can best help them, and make sure that we keep what we promise. We encourage a culture where successes are celebrated, learnings shared and support provided for our team members to succeed.
Keep Learning - Grow to excel. We aim for excellence by learning from the market, sharing our competence, and attracting talent with a growth mindset. We believe that expertise is not an achievement - it's a lifestyle of curiosity, learning, sharing and working with people who share the same hunger.
Ask Why - Know your why. We have the courage and agility to keep challenging what we're doing to assure value creation for customers. We encourage open dialogue and debate and strive for diversity in opinions to improve decision making.
Be Good - Positive impact. We always strive to be transparent and open in our communications, take ownership and aim for positive impact and results in all we do. We take pride in creating an equal and supportive workplace for talented and ambitious professionals from all nationalities, genders, orientations and backgrounds."

Title:
AI/ ML Engineer
AI/ ML Engineer
Job Description:
"About the job
WINGS ICT WINGS ICT Solutions is looking for an enthusiastic ML engineer to join it's growing team.

The successful candidate will be:

Working as part of a team, while also being independent 
Resolving interesting problems and gaining expertise in state-of-the-art technologies
Using Machine Learning techniques and Artificial Intelligence algorithms
Design and develop new predictive machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms for multiple industrial domains 
Integrate ML models into the production pipeline of our solutions
Analyze datasets to identify patterns, extract and present insights. 


Requirements

Educational requirements:

Candidates must have a Bachelor's Diploma in Compute Science, Electrical & Computer/Electronic engineering, Networks, Telecommunications or other relevant fields 
Master's Degree in the afore-mentioned areas will be considered as a strong plus 

Necessary skills:

At least 3 years of proven working experience as a ML Engineer 
Experience in data science and computer vision/ video imaging 
Familiarity with various Software Development tools will be a strong plus 
Highly skilled in Python and ML frameworks
Strong understanding of modeling and optimization techniques
Familiarity with software development practices and tools
Experience in data probing and preparation techniques
Skills in model tuning, including performance analysis, error analysis, and hyperparameter tuning. 

Nice to have skills:

Experience in energy/water facilities domain will be considered a strong asset


Benefits

Highly competitive salary, reviewed upwards on a regular basis, based on performance
Remuneration based on your experience and skills
Participation in state-of-the-art and large-scale projects
Personal and professional development, amongst industry experts
Continuous learning
Modern workspace, at a very good location

Commitment to Equal Employment Opportunity: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, or other characteristics.

We respect your personal data. All personal information in your application and CV will remain strictly confidential."

Title:
Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer
Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer
Job Description:
"About the job
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to engage our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity.

This could be your opportunity to lead a project of international scope and meet the challenges of digital transformation with an experienced and talented team.

At the same time, you are guaranteed to balance your work and family life, with premium benefits, stability and personal recognition.

💻 THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to perform duties as a Data Scientist and integrate an Intelligent Customer Service while building a software solution to transform user experience on an omnichannel context and focusing on self service channel. This project aims to leverage and transform institutions' support service by introducing Artifical Intelligence cross channels.

Required Qualifications

💡 WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

+2 years of professional experience in similar areas;
MSc degree or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field;
Demonstrated solid mathematical foundations and statistical consultancy, business sense, being able to quickly understand the use cases we are working on;
Proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning libraries such as PyTorch, scikit-learn, spaCy, NLTK, Hugging Face Transformers, etc;
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and techniques, including deep learning, natural language processing;
Experience with data pre-processing, feature engineering, and model evaluation;
Familiarity with data engineering, modelling and business analysis;
Good comunication skills.

Preferred/Additional Qualifications

Experience with Information Retrieval and LLMs;
Knowledge in Sentence Transformers, FastAPI;
Knowledge in technologies such as Opensearch;
Knowledge of cloud tools such as Azure, AWS, Google Cloud.

⭐ What You Can Expect From Us

Opportunity to lead major projects

By leading projects for an international Axians customer, you can make your mark in the IT world.

Recognition as a professional and as a person

For Axians, the professionals who lead customer projects have a name and a face and are therefore recognized by the company.

Work Life Balance And Premium Benefits

Axians values the family life of its employees by giving 5 days beyond those legally provided after the birth of children. Later, they can attend technology courses with resource to scholarships.

Possibility To Become a Shareholder In The Company

In addition to career progression, you can be a shareholder in the VINCI Energies Group, which owns Axians.

Stability and job security

Axians has 14,000 employees and revenues of around €3.3 billion. By leading major projects, you will join a solid and secure entity.

Fair Compensation

You will have access to basic salary + benefits and can also benefit from performance bonuses, health insurance and free psychologist consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is right for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with subject “DATASCIENCE_ML/TA/SR"".

Learn more about Axians"

Title:
Artificial Intelligence Prompt Engineer Intership
Artificial Intelligence Prompt Engineer Intership
Job Description:
"About the job
Dear Candidate,

We are excited to announce an opportunity for a AI Prompt Engineer Internship focused on Digital Healthcare at SpotLab. The use of digitalization technologies and Artificial Intelligence in the world of healthcare reveals great opportunities to benefit and improve patient’s care, reducing costs and improving global health. We can find many medical areas that are already getting the benefits of this new wave, however, others like hematology, infectious diseases, neglected tropical diseases, among others, still remain one step behind. SpotLab is fighting to bridge the gap.

We have received more than 10 international awards, including the Seal of Excellence of the European Union, being one of the most innovative start-up companies based on breakthrough innovations with scale and impact potential. We are a multidisciplinary orchestra with gender parity where developers, engineers, doctors, business managers, etc. with different professional backgrounds interact and complement each other.

As a Medical Prompt Engineer Intern, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects that will have a direct impact on improving patient outcomes and experiences. Your role will be to work with our team of experienced engineers to develop, test and implement automated prompt systems for our digital healthcare products.

The ideal candidate will have:

Curiosity about developing and implementing automated prompt systems.
Excellent programming skills, specifically in Python and JavaScript.
Knowledge of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Text-to-Speech (TTS) technologies.
Familiarity with medical terminology and healthcare processes.
Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Good written and verbal communication skills.


In return, we offer:

A comprehensive training program that will help you to develop your technical and professional skills.
A supportive and dynamic work environment that encourages learning and growth.
Opportunities to work on exciting and challenging projects.


If you are a highly motivated and enthusiastic individual with a passion for technology, we encourage you to apply for this internship opportunity. We look forward to receiving your application.

Sincerely, SpotLab"

Title:
Machine Learning Engineer
Machine Learning Engineer with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
You and your role

Working in an area where business and engineering teams collaborate closely to make a difference in how Rabobank engages with its customers. After all, your contribution is of real significance to us, as you will be working on topics like FEC (Financial Economic Crime) and CDD (Customer Due Diligence), which directly impact Rabobank’s operations. And of course, why not? This is the part that energizes you!

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be the pivotal link between business and IT development. You will optimize the Machine Learning (ML) Model workflow, development, and deployment with a platform-centric approach. We are focused on automating the entire Model Lifecycle as much as possible. Our goal is to provide a stable platform that can deliver models in a secure and regulatory-compliant way. Thanks to you, we can find people committing crimes and we can give our non-risky customers a flawless process.

In the domain of FEC Tech, you will have the opportunity to contribute to and work with the latest developments in the market, thereby maximizing the development of your knowledge and skills.

You And Your Responsibilities

Work on a key topic for our bank: Financial Economic Crime;
Develop, manage, and maintain Azure infrastructure that is specifically tailored for high-performance machine learning and artificial intelligence applications within the Rabobank.
Work in a multi-disciplined, highly skilled team to develop scalable solutions and ML pipelines throughout the entire ML cycle, collaborating closely with teams and data scientists.
Be responsible for ensuring the health of the system and models, monitoring data quality, performance, and business impact, and devising mitigation plans.
Identify underlying issues and opportunities across the ML development cycle and introduce tools for efficient development and testing.
Implement solutions in alignment with architectural guidelines, collaborating with your team.
Continuously evolve your craft by staying up to date with the latest technologies.

You and your talent

When we ask friends to describe you in a few keywords, the answers we’d like to hear are: customer-oriented, driven, possessing a strong analytical mind, a true team player, and eager to learn new techniques and developments. For this Machine Learning Engineer vacancy, you should also add:

A completed relevant HBO or WO education
Minimum 4 years of relevant experience in Software, Data, or ML Engineering (with at least 2 years specifically in ML Engineering) working (ideally on large data sets) with Python and PySpark (Azure Databricks experience is a plus)
Software development skills and good practices such as Git, release management, unit tests, testing strategy
Experience working in a cloud environment; preferably Azure.
Collaborate with data scientists and machine learning practitioners to provide infrastructure support for model development and deployment using Azure ML and Databricks
Passionate about building large scale data solutions in an efficient and scalable manner
You are familiar with setting up and managing CI/CD pipelines.
Experience with Agile and/or Scrum software development methodologies.

This Is What We Offer You

Up to : €70.000- gross per year depending on knowledge and experience;
A full thirteenth month salary and an 8% holiday allowance;
An Employee Benefit Budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or choose to have it paid out;
A budget of €750,- to set up your home working facilities and a monthly work-from-home allowance of up to €40,-;
An annual personal development budget of €1.400,-;
A combination of working from home and at the office;
100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport;
A pension scheme to which you contribute 3.5% or 5.5% (based on your personal preference);
172.8 hours holiday per year including 1 Diversity Day.

This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Machine Learning Engineer based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

You and the job application process

We appreciate to read your motivation for this role.
Any questions about the job content? Reach out to Daan Wijfje, Tech Lead via daan.wijfje@rabobank.nl.
Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Reach out to Charlotte Bos, IT Recruiter, via Charlotte.Bos@rabobank.nl.
You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

#ML #Data #MachineLearning #FEC #KYC"

Title:
Founding ML/Data Engineer
Founding ML/Data Engineer
Job Description:
"About the job
About Weve:
Weve is a European-based startup at the forefront of cloud security, well funded and backed by top-tier investors. Our mission is clear: to streamline security and operations in the cloud. We empower security engineers and analysts by giving them tools they need to quickly triage and remedy risk without the manual heavy lift.

Position Overview:
We're hiring a seasoned software engineer interested and experienced in data analysis and machine learning. Experienced in exploring and drawing insights from data lakes, designing and deploying ML pipelines and systems. You'll be working with us on cutting-edge problems at the intersection of security, SaaS development and analytics.
You'll be part of the founding team and define the trajectory of the company: while this role is focused on data analysis and ML, as part of a small team you'll be able to participate on all parts of SaaS development (e.g. frontend, backend, tooling, ETL), and have an active voice on the direction of the product.

What you will be tasked with…
Found, take ownership and lead a greenfield data insights component;
Design, build and own core algorithms powering our product;
Experiment, architect and build core ML infrastructure platforms to handle production scales of data.

What we’d love to see…
At least 5 years of industry experience, including relevant data analysis experience. You’ve written and supported services in production.
You have tangible experience in instrumenting and fine tuning ML models (e.g. classification, anomaly detection)
You have tangible experience with modern data tooling (e.g. Snowflake, Redshift, DBT, Spark, Dataframes)
Excellent technical written and verbal communication, including to non technical parties
End-to-end hat wearing: Within a talent-dense founding team, every member should be willing to handle tasks from infrastructure setups, troubleshooting hosted environments, tooling configuration, unit and integration testing, solution architecture proposals, product direction participation and customer support.

Some of our benefits include:
Competitive salary and equity in a fast growing start up
Opportunities to expand into data science, security research, and other areas
Remote opportunity from any European location"

Title:
Data Scientist
Data Scientist with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Join us!
If you’re ready to start the next chapter in your career journey, you’ve come to the right place. We’re always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply.

At Futurice, we're using advanced AI technology to transform how we work and help our clients. Last year, we successfully completed over 25 GenAI projects in different industries like law, media, logistics, manufacturing, and public sector. And there are tens of similar projects in progress. Our innovative use of AI has been recognized by top publications like Helsingin Sanomat and Taloussanomat. We've also collaborated with our clients to create over 60 real-world examples of how GenAI can be used in the public sector. You can read more about our work in our Generative AI Working Paper.

About the role
We are seeking a talented and accomplished Machine Learning Engineer to join our innovative and inclusive team of Data at Futurice. This is an extraordinary opportunity for a team player who is passionate about Generative AI, LLMs, and RAG. This role will be crucial for contributing to our generative AI initiatives, solving complex problems, and providing advice to decision-makers. We offer a hybrid working mode that allows for flexibility, but it is important that the candidate is located close to one of our Finland offices (Helsinki or Tampere) to ensure seamless collaboration. Please kindly note that, at this time, we are unable to offer relocation opportunities, or we will need to be highly selective in considering such requests.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead the design and development of tailored solutions that leverage GenAI, harnessing the power of Large Language Models (LLM) to address complex business challenges.
Work with LLMs, vector embeddings, and retrieval systems to develop a comprehensive GenAI application that leverages advanced natural language processing (NLP) techniques for tasks such as text generation, summarization, question answering, and content recommendation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, contributing to the development of AI use cases that contribute real value to the users.
Advise and support stakeholders on applying AI methodologies in their business to enable data-driven decision-making.
Lead and mentor within the AI domain, driving innovation and excellence in the Data Competence.
Support our sales team, leveraging your technical expertise to contribute to customer success and drive project engagements.

Qualifications:
MSc in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related quantitative field with a strong focus on analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Experience in GenAI, machine learning, and software development, with a history of successfully implementing (generative) AI use cases into practical solutions.
Proficiency in programming skills such as Python and other AI-related libraries and frameworks. Hands-on experience working with LLM APIs e.g. GPT or Llama2 and understanding of NLP coupled with LLMs.
Demonstrated ability in AI/ML solution architecture design and experience with data and AI tools on popular cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure.
Possession of relevant certifications in cloud technology or GenAI.
Excellent communication skills in Finnish and English, capable of explaining complex concepts to non-technical audiences. 

Next steps
If this sounds like the opportunity you’ve been looking for and are ready to take the next step, please submit your application.

How we work
Ever since Futurice was founded, we’ve been committed to offering a workplace people will genuinely enjoy coming to every morning, Mondays included. We’ve put tons of effort into fostering a healthy and welcoming company culture combined with fair and competitive salaries as well as perks that improve the wellbeing of each Futuricean – take a look here to learn more, check our Culture handbook 2.0 and get to know some of our people through their career stories. Each of our offices also adds its own unique vibe and flavor into the mix. Learn more about our offices here!

At Futurice, new joiners are not expected to fit into a specific mold – people are free to come as they are, regardless of their background. We believe there’s power in perspectives and consider diversity an important part of our success. You can learn more about our DE&I commitment and efforts here.

We're Futurice
We are Futurice, an outcome-focused digital transformation company.We help our clients solve their biggest challenges and empower them to make a positive impact on the world.

Founded in 2000, our team comprises over 800 diverse experts who represent more than 60 different nationalities. We have Nordic roots and a global mindset and operate across Europe."

Title:
Machine Learning Engineer For AI Email Marketing Platform
Machine Learning Engineer For AI Email Marketing Platform
Job Description:
"About the job
Warsaw-based opportunity with a dynamic role as a Machine Learning Engineer! 🌟

Pareto Publishing, a leader in email marketing and financial advertising, is offering a unique opportunity to be part of our growing Warsaw-based team.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be developing cutting-edge models to monetize vast email databases, to help with personalized client interactions and optimizing marketing strategies.

The best part? We're looking to start this adventure with you ASAP. After two online interviews, you will be invited to our office, located opposite the Warsaw Spire.

We offer you:

💰Competitive salary + uncapped bonuses: Reflecting your experience and the impact you make
📈Career growth: Opportunity to lead industry-first initiatives in a rapidly growing company
🧠 Professional development: Access to cutting-edge projects and technologies in the financial industry
🎉 Energetic workplace culture: Work with a diverse and dynamic team across multiple countries
🎁 Extra perks: Including health packages and incentives like paid trips and bonuses upon reaching targets

Your main responsibilities:

🤖Deploying and managing machine learning models. You will build predictive models to enhance customer engagement through personalized email content
🤝Collaborating with data teams. You'll have a chance to work closely with our data engineering team to ensure efficient data collection, cleaning, and processing for model training
🛠️Developing automated pipelines. You will be responsible for implementing and maintaining pipelines for continuous data collection, model training, testing, and deployment using our proprietary CRM and tools like Amazon AWS
📊Optimizing model performance. You will help our team to regularly update and refine models to improve predictive accuracy and operational efficiency
📑Stakeholder engagement. It will also be important to produce reports and dashboards (e.g., Tableau) to communicate insights to the marketing team, helping with all decision-making processes

You're ideal for this role if you have:

🎓Proven experience in machine learning. Practical skills in building and deploying models, with a strong grasp of Python and libraries such as TensorFlow and scikit-learn
🔍Strong analytical skills. Ability to handle complex data sets and derive actionable insights from them
🗃️Experience with big data technologies. Familiarity with AWS cloud services and database management
📅Project management skills. Comfortable with agile development processes and tools such as Jira and Confluence
🌐Fluent English. Excellent communication skills to collaborate with international teams


BONUS: Although it's not necessary, it is a strong plus if you have some background in e-mail marketing/ experience with e-mail service platforms.

Sounds good? Apply now and let's make some big things happen together! 🚀"

Title:
AI / Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d)
AI / Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d) with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Do you want to help create the future of healthcare? Our name, Siemens Healthineers, was selected to honor our people who dedicate their energy and passion to this cause. It reflects their pioneering spirit combined with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting?

Then come and join our global Center of Excellence for Business Intelligence Front-End Tools and Artificial Intelligence as AI / Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d). The “AI Service” is a central service that provides a platform for data scientists and non-data scientists alike to implement AI related use cases.

Our prime goal is the provision of value by designing, establishing, and operating Artificial Intelligence based solutions for internal Siemens Healthineers use cases, as well as providing guidance, training, and overall support.

Your tasks and responsibilities:

You will engage with internal stakeholders and collect requirements to convert their demands into efficient, compliant, and valuable solutions.
You will assess use case requests regarding feasibility, effort, and business value, prioritize based on pre-defined parameters, and provide feedback to our stakeholders. 
You will work on Machine Learning projects, where you independently or as part of a project team
Choose the right approach to solve the problem at hand.
Familiarize yourself with domain knowledge of our internal customers.
Combine disjoint complicated datasets and prepare them for downstream processing.
Build features based on your understanding of the domain in question.
Train and/or deploy models using technologies such as (Databricks, Azure ML, LLMs, Azure Cognitive Services & Snowflake)
Track and manage the overall solutions that have been deployed (ML Ops)
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive advanced analytics and digitalization.

Your qualifications and experience:

 You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in a field where you demonstrated advanced analytical aptitude.
You have several years of experience with AI / Machine Learning processes and are familiar with state-of-the-art libraries and tools
You are familiar with technologies and ML platforms like Databricks, MLflow, Azure ML and the Azure Cognitive Services, modern software development concepts, and have experience with code management platforms like Azure DevOps
You have a sound understanding of data processing and transformation using SQL, pandas, and Spark.
You do have experience visualizing rich data sets in Python and BI tools like Power BI, Qlik, or Tableau.
You do have experience in using LLMs for the processing of unstructured data or as a coding companion that helps you be efficient in achieving your goals.

Your attributes and skills:

Your business-fluent English enables you to collaborate and communicate with colleagues in an international environment.
You are exactly the right person for this position if you combine technical knowledge with excellent communication skills.
You work creatively and independently to find solutions for today’s and tomorrow’s challenges
You are open to occasional business travels 
You are located in Poland 
 You work reliably and liaise with other team members to understand the requirements and demands to be implemented.

We offer:

 Exciting work in international corporation
 You can work remotely/hybrid/in one of our local offices
 We provide necessary tools

If you are interested use the “Apply” button.

Our culture:

Siemens Healthineers is a Great Place To Work®!

In the survey accompanying the certification, 91% of employees stated that Siemens Healthineers in Poland is a great place to work. This is supported by the survey results, which highlight an organizational culture based on fairness, community care, and engaged leadership.

At Siemens Healthineers, we take into account different perspectives, are open to dialogue and challenge conventions. Change is an integral part of our work. We strive to be a leader of change in our industry, not just to respond to them. We invite you to take on new challenges with us, test your ideas and celebrate successes.

We highly value diversity, inclusion and equal opportunities, so we warmly invite everyone, regardless of their gender identity, to apply for this position. We also encourage people with disabilities to apply.

Do you want to know more? Contact us.

At https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/pl/ you will find additional information about our areas of activities.

We care about data privacy and take it seriously in accordance with the GDPR and other regulations related to personal data protection. For this reason, please do not send us your CV or other application documents by e-mail. Instead, please create your profile on our Career Portal https://jobs.siemens-healthineers.com/careers, which allows you to submit your documents, apply for open positions and to obtain information about our vacancies and career development at Siemens."

Title:
Junior AI Engineer
Junior AI Engineer with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Ubicación:

Madrid, ES, 28046

Fecha: 15 jul. 2024

¿Eres únic@?

Entonces eres KPMG Originals. Un modo de entender la vida y tu profesión diferente desde donde marcar la diferencia. Un modo de crecer en un ambiente profesional que busca cambiar las cosas, transformar las empresas y la sociedad.

Ven, alcanza tus metas, supera tus límites en un ambiente profesional único y únete a una firma que es más que una firma de Servicios Profesionales. Sé KPMG Originals.

¿Qué podrás hacer?

Desde el equipo de LIGHTHOUSE, nuestra área de Data & Analytics, ayudamos a nuestros clientes a encontrar la eficiencia y el alto rendimiento en todas sus funciones TIC, tanto internas como externas hacia sus unidades de negocio y proveedores: buscando la máxima eficiencia en la operación de sus servicios y ajustando sus costes; así como incrementando su trascendencia en la cuenta de resultados y facilitando la innovación.

Actualmente, nos encontramos ampliando el equipo con un/a perfil Junior con experienica en proyectos de Inteligencia Artificial.

¿Qué necesitas saber?

Tener 1-2 años de experiencia laboral
Título universitario en Ciencias de la Computación, Ingeniería, Matemáticas u otro campo relacionado. 
Experiencia en el desarrollo / configuración de modelos de IA generativa y/o LLM, deseable experiencia / certificación en servicios Azure OpenAI
Habilidad de programación en lenguajes como Python. 
Experiencia en el manejo de grandes conjuntos de datos y en el procesamiento de datos para tareas de IA. 
Capacidad de colaborar de manera efectiva en un entorno interdisciplinario. 

¿Qué valor añadido te podemos aportar?

Un gran ambiente de trabajo, tanto dentro como fuera de la oficina
Oportunidades internacionales y red de contactos global
Formacióncontinuay plan de carrera a tu medida
Salario competitivo y plan de remuneración flexible
31 días laborables de vacaciones
La tarde de tu cumpleaños libre
Flexibilidad y posibilidad de teletrabajo
Acceso a Kteam, nuestra plataforma de bienestar, servicios, solidaridad y promociones 
Los beneficios pueden variar para programas de becas y/o prácticas

Nuestro compromiso en KPMG es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social. Y es que cada persona tiene un valor único y especial que aportar a la firma.

Nuestros valores marcan la diferencia. Marca la diferencia, impulsa tu talento."

Title:
anúncio de trabalho: Junior Data Science/Artificial Intelligence Programmer
anúncio de trabalho: Junior Data Science/Artificial Intelligence Programmer
Job Description:
"About the job
