Title:
Data Engineer - Ops Spark Kafka Python H/F
Data Engineer - Ops Spark Kafka Python H/F
Job Description:
"About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Lancé en 2021, Team.is est une start-up de recrutement spécialisée dans la chasse et le recrutement de profils IT, Digital, Ingénierie & Supply Chain.

Team.is c'est avant tout une entreprise à taille humaine animée par la passion du recrutement !

Team.is possède l'expertise et l'énergie pour s'attaquer à n'importe quel défi. Mais nous ne sommes pas des robots du recrutement. Nous sommes des consultants qui vivent et respirent ce que nous faisons ! Nous sommes déterminés à réaliser le meilleur travail possible pour cultiver des relations durables avec nos candidats et nos clients.

En postulant à cette offre, vous aurez l'opportunité de rejoindre une entreprise prometteuse avec une forte diversité de projets. Il s'agit d'une société qui a créé une plate-forme de connectivité cellulaire offrant à l'industrie automobile une nouvelle façon de permettre et d'améliorer le fonctionnement de ses voitures connectées à l'échelle mondiale.

Fondée en 2021 par des entrepreneurs télécoms chevronnés et d'anciens cadres d'acteurs des télécoms, de l'IOT, de la voiture connectée et de la télématique, l'entreprise recherche pour compléter son équipe un Data Engineer / Ops (Spark, Kafka, Python) H/F.

Vos Missions Si Vous Les Acceptez

En tant que membre de leur équipe Data, vous serez responsable de la définition, du développement et de l'exploitation de nos pipelines de traitement des données. La finalité principale est l'amélioration de la visibilité et du contrôle en interne et pour nos partenaires.

Étant donné que notre organisation suit un modèle holacratique, vous aurez des opportunités de contribuer au-delà de cette description, soit en restant spécialisé sur les données (analyse des données, visualisation, etc.), soit en explorant d'autres domaines.

Aucune connaissance préalable des spécificités des télécommunications n'est requise. Vous recevrez une formation à ce sujet pendant le processus de développement.

Vos Principales Responsabilités Comprendront

 Conception et architecture
 Sélection des technologies à mettre en oeuvre
 Développement de pipelines de traitement des données
 Mise en oeuvre de l'intégration et du déploiement continus
 Rédaction de tests automatisés
 Exploitation des solutions

Avantages

Notre client étant organisé en Holacratie, vous aurez toute liberté de proposer le ou les roles que vous souhaiterez assumer afin de faire bénéficier au mieux l'équipe de votre expérience. Vous pourrez également développer de nouvelles compétences en choisissant d'autres roles.

L'entreprise propose du 100% télétravail, vous pourrez travailler de n'importe où en France.

Autres Avantages

 Entre 8 et 11 jours de RTT par an
 3000€ HT de budget d'installation pour vous équiper - ce budget inclu votre laptop (Fame.work ou Macbook Pro)
 57.20 € / mois de prime télétravail
 2 rassemblements d'une semaine par an quelque part en France avec toute l'équipe
 Possibilité de co-working

Et vous ?

Vous êtes un ingénieur de données expérimenté et adaptable qui a réussi à naviguer avec succès dans des lancements de production sous haute pression, en particulier avec de grands volumes de données. Vous possédez une pensée indépendante, des compétences de résolution proactive des problèmes et une attitude positive. Vous êtes à la recherche de nouveaux défis techniques et êtes ouvert à explorer des approches non conventionnelles dans votre travail. Vous parlez français et vous êtes à l'aise en anglais. Compétences techniques

 Spark
 Kafka
 Python
 Delta Lake
 Grafana
 GCP
 Kubernetes
 ArgoCD & CrossPlane
 GitHub"

Title:
DATA SCIENTIST AND MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER Industry & Logistics
DATA SCIENTIST AND MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER Industry & Logistics
Job Description:
"About the job
Are you ready to embark on a challenging journey of discovering and applying novel Machine Learning and AI-driven solutions in process monitoring, control and optimization for different industrial sectors?

The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit of EURECAT is looking for a highly motivated Data Scientist and Machine Learning engineer to help us pave the way in transforming industries, and creating a smarter, more sustainable future.

Whether it’s algorithms or data analytics, we’re here to revolutionize the industrial sector.
Industrial Control Systems: from single automation devices to complex machines, we’re exploring AI-based approaches across various levels of industrial control systems: Sensor fusion, model predictive control, self-optimizing processes, surrogate modelling, etc.
Zero-Defect Manufacturing: Imagine a world where defects are extinct. We’re on a mission to achieve it! Our focus? Quality prediction, resource optimization, predictive maintenance, and ensuring each process runs as smoothly as possible.
Collaboration: Join our multidisciplinary team. Learn, grow, and contribute. Be part of the ML-driven industrial revolution


Responsabilities

As a valued member of our team, your role encompasses several critical dimensions:

Innovative Solutions: You’ll delve into the intricate world of data-driven solutions, harnessing the power of multimodal data across industrial contexts.
TimeSeries analytics: Expect to wield advanced tools like Recurrent Neural Networks and Autoencoders.
Code Craftsmanship: Your code will be the bedrock of our innovations. Rigorous validation and refinement ensure optimal efficiency.
Global Impact: Collaborate on scientific publications, sharing your insights with the wider research community.
Tailored Growth: We recognize your unique strengths and interests. Your responsibilities will evolve accordingly, fostering personalized development within our team.
Project Leadership: As you grow and the projects unfold, your adept project management skills will steer us toward success.


WHAT EURECAT CAN OFFER YOU? 

Our group is specialized in applied research and development on ML and AI solutions. The Applied Artificial Intelligence Unit of Eurecat develops innovative solutions (algorithms, methods, platforms) based on a combination of artificial intelligence and knowledge management technologies, especially for the industrial, energy and sustainability sectors. We have over 12 years of experience pushing the adoption of state-of-the-art AI and ML solutions for our private customers as well as for relevant European research projects! Check out our portfolio:

Applied Artificial Intelligence - Eurecat (applied-artificial-intelligence-eurecat.github.io)

Applied Artificial Intelligence Eurecat Technological Centre

And …

Permanent contract 
Hybrid work (3 home office/2 work in the office) 
Flexible Schedule 
Shorter workday on Friday and Summer Schedule 
Flexible remuneration package (health insurance, transport, lunch, studies - training and kindergarten) 
Eurecat workers can join the Eurecat Academy courses 
Eurecat workers can attend to our weekly thematic sessions to be aware of Eurecat areas of knowledge. 
Language’s training (English, Catalan and Spanish) 


Requirements:

A passion for DataScience and ML, backed by an MSc or equivalent experience in ML, AI, Computer Vision, or a related field. 
Hands-on experience with Machine Learning, Deep Learning, with a track record of applying AI techniques. 
Proficiency in Python. 
Open minded: Eager to learn new domains: how the industrial processes work and its fine details.
Dynamic communication skills, allowing you to effectively convey complex ideas and collaborate with colleagues from diverse backgrounds. 
A readiness to travel when needed, embracing opportunities to connect with clients, partners, and collaborators worldwide."

Title:
ML Data Engineer
ML Data Engineer with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences - the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance_

ML Data Engineer

LOCATION: Sweden, France, Germany, Poland, UK, Belgium, Holland

The Role

AMD is looking for a strategic ML Engineer who understands the importance that high quality data has in the production of successful machine learning solutions. You will aid in the data generation/gathering processing and oversee different steps of the training pipeline to ensure efficient processing. You will be a member of a core team of incredibly talented industry specialists and will work with the very latest hardware and software technology.

The Person

The ideal candidate is a highly skilled data scientist or machine learning engineer. You are interested in real time graphics, and you are excited about the next generation of machine learning techniques will unlock in this field. You are team-driven and understand what is required to train advanced neural networks and are motivated to do things others might find too difficult.

Key Responsibilities

Ability to effectively work with large amounts of data to support machine learning pipelines.
Generate or gather data to improve machine learning models.
Ability to work with Pytorch.
Proficient in Python for rapid prototyping and testing.
Comprehensive understanding of general software development workflows, including version control systems like Git, build automation tools like CMake, and continuous integration (CI) pipelines.
Proficient in English, with excellent written and verbal communication skills for collaborating with team members and presenting findings or proposals.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including researchers, engineers, and domain experts to understand requirements, develop prototypes, and improve processes.
Document code, methodologies, and findings comprehensively, ensuring reproducibility and knowledge sharing within the team and across the organization.
Mentor junior team members, providing guidance on machine learning concepts, programming techniques, and software development practices to foster skill development and team growth.


Preferred Experience

Minimum 2 years of full-time (post grad) experience with machine learning, preferably in the context of data acquisition/processing and training.
Familiarity with Machine Learning tools such as ONNX and PyTorch.
Has strong graphics code optimization skills, in particular shader code optimizations.
Ability to write high-quality, maintainable code with meticulous attention to detail, ensuring robustness and high performance.
Experience with modern concurrent programming paradigms and threading APIs to develop parallel and distributed machine learning algorithms efficiently.
Effective communication and problem-solving skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


The Following Experiences Are Optional But Highly Desired

GCN / RDNA graphics architecture experience.
Familiarity with 3D graphics using GPU Compute and popular graphics APIs such as Direct3D, Vulkan, OpenGL, OpenCL, CUDA, and HIP.
Game engine or game rendering framework experience


Academic Credentials

Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent 


Benefits offered are described: AMD benefits at a glance.

AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process."

Title:
AI / Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d)
AI / Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d) with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Do you want to help create the future of healthcare? Our name, Siemens Healthineers, was selected to honor our people who dedicate their energy and passion to this cause. It reflects their pioneering spirit combined with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting?

Then come and join our global Center of Excellence for Business Intelligence Front-End Tools and Artificial Intelligence as AI / Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d). The “AI Service” is a central service that provides a platform for data scientists and non-data scientists alike to implement AI related use cases.

Our prime goal is the provision of value by designing, establishing, and operating Artificial Intelligence based solutions for internal Siemens Healthineers use cases, as well as providing guidance, training, and overall support.

Your tasks and responsibilities:

You will engage with internal stakeholders and collect requirements to convert their demands into efficient, compliant, and valuable solutions.
You will assess use case requests regarding feasibility, effort, and business value, prioritize based on pre-defined parameters, and provide feedback to our stakeholders. 
You will work on Machine Learning projects, where you independently or as part of a project team
Choose the right approach to solve the problem at hand.
Familiarize yourself with domain knowledge of our internal customers.
Combine disjoint complicated datasets and prepare them for downstream processing.
Build features based on your understanding of the domain in question.
Train and/or deploy models using technologies such as (Databricks, Azure ML, LLMs, Azure Cognitive Services & Snowflake)
Track and manage the overall solutions that have been deployed (ML Ops)
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive advanced analytics and digitalization.

Your qualifications and experience:

 You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in a field where you demonstrated advanced analytical aptitude.
You have several years of experience with AI / Machine Learning processes and are familiar with state-of-the-art libraries and tools
You are familiar with technologies and ML platforms like Databricks, MLflow, Azure ML and the Azure Cognitive Services, modern software development concepts, and have experience with code management platforms like Azure DevOps
You have a sound understanding of data processing and transformation using SQL, pandas, and Spark.
You do have experience visualizing rich data sets in Python and BI tools like Power BI, Qlik, or Tableau.
You do have experience in using LLMs for the processing of unstructured data or as a coding companion that helps you be efficient in achieving your goals.

Your attributes and skills:

Your business-fluent English enables you to collaborate and communicate with colleagues in an international environment.
You are exactly the right person for this position if you combine technical knowledge with excellent communication skills.
You work creatively and independently to find solutions for today’s and tomorrow’s challenges
You are open to occasional business travels 
You are located in Poland 
 You work reliably and liaise with other team members to understand the requirements and demands to be implemented.

We offer:

 Exciting work in international corporation
 You can work remotely/hybrid/in one of our local offices
 We provide necessary tools

If you are interested use the “Apply” button.

Our culture:

Siemens Healthineers is a Great Place To Work®!

In the survey accompanying the certification, 91% of employees stated that Siemens Healthineers in Poland is a great place to work. This is supported by the survey results, which highlight an organizational culture based on fairness, community care, and engaged leadership.

At Siemens Healthineers, we take into account different perspectives, are open to dialogue and challenge conventions. Change is an integral part of our work. We strive to be a leader of change in our industry, not just to respond to them. We invite you to take on new challenges with us, test your ideas and celebrate successes.

We highly value diversity, inclusion and equal opportunities, so we warmly invite everyone, regardless of their gender identity, to apply for this position. We also encourage people with disabilities to apply.

Do you want to know more? Contact us.

At https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/pl/ you will find additional information about our areas of activities.

We care about data privacy and take it seriously in accordance with the GDPR and other regulations related to personal data protection. For this reason, please do not send us your CV or other application documents by e-mail. Instead, please create your profile on our Career Portal https://jobs.siemens-healthineers.com/careers, which allows you to submit your documents, apply for open positions and to obtain information about our vacancies and career development at Siemens."

Title:
Staff Machine Learning Engineer
Staff Machine Learning Engineer
Job Description:
"About the job
Our client, a leading AI-driven computer software organization, are hiring a Staff Machine Learning Engineer to join their team in Dublin. The successful candidate will join an exciting ML team that are leading the charge in defining new ML features, researching cutting-edge algorithms and technologies, and swiftly deploying initial prototypes to global customers.

Responsibilities:

 As the Staff Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for identifying areas where ML can create value for our customers. 
 You will contribute to framing product problems with an ML perspective. 
 Collaborate with teammates and Product and Design stakeholders. 
 Transition offline algorithms into production settings. 
 Solve scalability and optimization challenges, as well as run and evolve production ML infrastructure. 
 Build new data infrastructure to enable exploration. 
 Establish processes for large-scale data analysis, model development, validation and implementation. 

Skillset:

 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar. 
 At least seven years in a production environment, contributing to the design and architecture of distributed systems. 
 Familiarity with tools for writing, testing, deploying, debugging and monitoring software. 
 Experience owning features from inception to outcome. 
 Ability to confidently put ML-powered features into production. 
 Excellent programming skills. 
 Deep knowledge of AWS services and MLOps experience is a bonus. 
 Practical statistics knowledge (experiment design, dealing with confounding etc). 
 Experience in applicable ML areas such as NLP, Deep Learning, Bayesian methods, Reinforcement Learning and clustering. 

Benefits:

 Salary: €140k – €180k + Equity 
 Comprehensive benefits package. 

If this sounds like the role for you, apply now in the link below or email your CV to mark@alldus.com for consideration.

44870"

Title:
Junior Data Engineer con AWS y Snowflake
Junior Data Engineer con AWS y Snowflake
Job Description:
"About the job
En serem estamos comprometidos con diversos proyectos y queremos contar con los mejores profesionales del sector. Actualmente, nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un/a Ingeniero de Datos Junior con un fuerte enfoque en el desarrollo de soluciones de ingeniería de datos y experiencia demostrada en el manejo de tecnologías clave. Los candidatos ideales deberán cumplir con los siguientes requisitos:

Experiencia:
Al menos 1 a 3 años en desarrollo de soluciones de ingeniería de datos.
Desarrollo de pipelines y orquestación de flujos para la transformación de datos.
Procesos ETL.

Tecnologías y Conocimientos:
Experiencia en el stack AWS (Glue, AppFlow, Athena, S3).
Experiencia indispensable con bases de datos Snowflake.
Competencia en Python y SQL.
Familiaridad con metodologías ágiles (Agile).

Idiomas:
Buen nivel de inglés, ya que trabajará con clientes internacionales.

Responsabilidades:
Desarrollar y mantener pipelines de datos eficientes y robustos utilizando AWS y Snowflake.
Participar en la orquestación y automatización de flujos de trabajo de datos.
Colaborar con equipos multifuncionales para garantizar la calidad y eficacia de las soluciones de datos.
Implementar procesos ETL que soporten las necesidades de análisis y reporting.

Ofrecemos
Ubicación: Oficinas en Viladecans, Barcelona. Se requiere presencialidad de 2 a 3 días por semana.
Se cubren los gastos de desplazamiento desde Barcelona.


Desarrollamos nuestras actividades bajo los principios del cuidado del medioambiente, la sostenibilidad y la responsabilidad social corporativa; colaborando en proyectos de reforestación y sostenibilidad.

Apoyamos los 10 principios del Pacto Mundial y los 17 Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible, en materia de derechos humanos, condiciones laborales, medio ambiente y anticorrupción.

Los procesos de reclutamiento se desarrollan bajo altos estándares de calidad definiendo la incorporación en base a la experiencia y habilidades del candidato.

Somos una empresa española líder en servicios tecnológicos y atracción del talento presente en el mercado desde 1995. Contamos con más de 600 empleados en proyectos tanto nacionales como internacionales en sector TI."

Title:
AI Developer
AI Developer
Job Description:
"About the job
Ciao, talento del tech! 🌟Siamo MatchGuru, piacere di conoscerti!
Ci presentiamo, come è giusto che sia 🤝MatchGuru è più di una piattaforma: è l'epicentro dove talenti e aziende si scoprono, capiscono e incontrano. Un mix (già leggendario) di tecnologia e competenza, progettato per match che vanno oltre l'eccellenza. Con le nostre soluzioni tecnologiche proprietarie, acceleriamo ed efficientiamo il processo di selezione, liberandolo da rallentamenti ed errori. Questo ci rende anche una vera e propria guida per talenti, che accompagniamo verso le opportunità più affini alle proprie caratteristiche e aspettative.
Cosa ci facciamo qui 👀Oltre a garantire match perfetti a te, aiutiamo in tutti i modi le aziende a scovare i talenti più affini al proprio DNA, assicurando una perfetta compatibilità di skill, aspettative, aspirazioni e valori. Vogliamo assicurare soddisfazione e gratificazione sia ai talenti, che alle aziende.
⭐ L’opportunitàPosizione: AI Developer, per startup ITSeniority: almeno 3 anni nel settoreDove: Full Remote
💼 Le tue responsabilità includeranno…Creazione di sistemi di IA che simulano capacità cognitive umane.Sviluppare e implementare algoritmi di apprendimento automatico e reti neurali.
💡 Potresti fare match con questa posizione se…Conoscenza di linguaggi come Python, Java, C++.Hai conoscenza degli algoritmi di regressione, classificazione, clustering.Hai familiarità con reti neurali profonde (Deep Learning).Hai sperienza con TensorFlow, PyTorch,
💶 Ma andiamo al sodo: ecco cosa ti offronoContratto a Tempo Indeterminato, assunzione direttaRange RAL: 35-40K
Se pensi di essere il match perfetto per questa opportunità o conosci qualcuno che potrebbe esserlo, candidati subito oppure contattaci! 📩
Proviamo a matchare? 🚀
⚡IMPORTANTE⚡
Non possiamo prometterti che questa azienda cliente sarà interessata al tuo profilo ma, iscrivendoti una sola volta alla nostra piattaforma (tramite il bottone ""Candidati"" che trovi in questa offerta), avrai la possibilità di matchare con tante aziende in cerca di profili qualificati, proprio come te.E il bello è che il match avverrà solo in caso di reale compatibilità: non solo di competenze, ma anche di valori, obiettivi e preferenze tuoi e dell'azienda. È il momento di trovare quella combinazione perfetta che ti porterà al successo professionale! 🌟"

Title:
Stage / Alternance, Junior Data / Analytics Engineer - Sport Products (f/m/d)
Stage / Alternance, Junior Data / Analytics Engineer - Sport Products (f/m/d) with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Introduction

Decathlon accélère sa transformation digitale avec pour mission de devenir LA plateforme numérique sportive qui permettra aux clients de découvrir notre univers à travers de nombreuses expériences locales centrées sur le sport.

Notre but est de créer un écosystème ouvert afin de connecter de nombreux acteurs et services tiers, de manière sûre et performante.

Nos équipes digitales basées à Lille, Paris et Amsterdam regroupent plus de 1500 collaborateurs qui sont unis pour construire et faire grandir des produits numériques dans le but de toujours offrir la meilleure valeur à nos utilisateurs.

Decathlon Digital

Et si la Tech nous permettait de réinventer le sport de demain et de devenir la plus grande plateforme numérique sportive ? c’est l’objectif que nous nous fixons chez Decathlon.

“Rendre durablement les plaisirs et les bienfaits du sport accessibles au plus grand nombre” est notre mission depuis toujours. Une vocation qui atteint aujourd’hui son paroxysme en augmentant l’expérience du sport par les technologies et répondant aux besoins de nos 500 millions d’utilisateurs à travers le monde.

Nous créons ainsi de nouvelles expériences pour les sportives et sportifs – coaching virtuel, programmes de fidélité, expériences intelligentes en magasin, offres de produits neufs et d'occasion, mais aussi services de location d'une large gamme de produits Decathlon et de partenaires.

Decathlon Digital, c’est aujourd’hui plus de 5000 profils techniques : software engineers, product managers, expert e s de la data, du Cloud et de la cybersécurité, en France et à l’étranger, implantées à Paris, Lille, Nantes, Lyon, et Amsterdam.

Notre équipe Data Wonder Offer cherche sa.son Analytics Engineer stagiaire / Alternant.e basé.e à Lille

L'équipe Data Wonder Offer a la responsabilité de plusieurs produits Analytics & IA contribuant au maintien de l’efficience de l’offre de Decathlon (détection de produits similaires, optimisation d’assortiment, monitoring de la performance produit…).

Avec des produits en cours de build qui devront être industrialisés mais également des cas d’usage qui doivent encore être cadrés. Tu seras impliqué.e dans l’industrialisation de l’ensemble de ces produits.

Sur le plan humain, l’équipe Data Wonder Offer est aujourd’hui constituée de 9 personnes :

1 Data PM, 1 Analytics Engineer, 2 BI Engineers, 1 Data Analyst, 2 Data Scientists, 2 ML Engineers
À venir : 1 Data Scientist, 1 Analytics Engineer


Vos responsabilités

En tant que Analytics Engineer stagiaire/alternant.e, vous aurez l’occasion de :

Automatiser et industrialiser les pipelines de transformation de données qui servent aux dashboards, modèles IA et data analyses
Construire et modéliser la semantic layer de domaine métier (commerce, supply, sports, etc.) ;
Définir la stratégie de nos stacks techniques et garantir la qualité des données exposées ;
Maintenir et repenser les datasets et pipelines existants pour servir une plus large variété de use cases ;
Permettre de l'analytique intelligente en construisant des datasets robustes, fiables et pertinents ;
Contribuer activement à notre communauté d'analytics engineers et de data engineers ;


Le périmètre technique

Data-platform : Amazon Web Services, Databricks, Glue, S3
Code Programming : SQL, Python, Scala
Data orchestration : Airflow
Data modeling : dbt
Data quality : great_expectations
Software Delivery : Git, Github, Make


Skills

Connaissance de Python et SQL comme langage de programmation
Connaissances en modélisation dimensionnelle
Connaissances et expérience avec Databricks, dbt, Airflow, pyspark, git est un plus
Curiosité et proactivité pour comprendre le besoin métier
Rigueur pour délivrer de la donnée de qualité
Une volonté d’apprendre et d’apporter de la valeur
Une forte appétence pour la découverte et la résolution de problèmes


Ce que nous offrons

Flexibilité dans l'organisation du travail (lieu, rythme)
Liberté de choix de l'outil de travail (Mac, Windows)
Équipe de projet locale et partage avec le réseau mondial (parcours international)
Montée en compétences (diversité des projets, des langues et des technologies)
Formations internes et externes
Actionnariat salariés
Primes mensuelles et trimestrielles


DECATHLON DIGITAL 

Imaginez si la technologie nous permettait de repousser les frontières et d'offrir des expériences sportives inédites. C'est précisément notre ambition chez Decathlon Digital ! Nous sommes une équipe de plus de 5 000 experts en ingénierie logicielle, gestion de produits, données, cloud et cybersécurité, répartis à Paris, Lille et Amsterdam. Ensemble, nous créons la plus vaste plateforme sportive numérique, en exploitant les innovations technologiques pour optimiser la chaîne de valeur, concevoir des expériences connectées et donner une seconde vie à nos produits.

Changeons la donne pour de bon. Notre passion du sport nous guide et nous voulons qu’elle perdure. C’est pourquoi nous nous engageons à bâtir un modèle technologique plus durable, en réduisant notre impact direct sur l'environnement, et en créant un espace sûr et inclusif pour apprendre et nous épanouir ensemble. Rejoins l’équipe et façonnons le futur du sport."

Title:
Artificial Intelligence Engineer, 2 Hour Learning (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
Artificial Intelligence Engineer, 2 Hour Learning (Remote) - $100,000/year USD with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, 2 Hour Learning. Have you got what it takes?

Are you a full-stack AI wizard ready to redefine the frontier of K-12 learning? Join the education revolution at 2 Hour Learning!

At 2 Hour Learning, we're not just talking about transforming education - we're proving it with hard data. Our learning ecosystem harnesses cutting-edge AI, learning science, and psychometrics to create a digital learning environment that's twice as effective as traditional schooling. High schoolers ace AP exams, middle schoolers advance 2 grade levels per year, and even kindergarteners shatter learning goals.

You'll play a pivotal role in architecting this AI-powered learning revolution. You'll wield autonomy and creative freedom to envision, code, and ship sophisticated full-stack applications and interactive AI tools that engage students and drive learning efficiency to unprecedented heights.

This isn't a role for AI dabblers or back-end-only coders. We seek bold AI architects who can seamlessly weave AI magic across front-end interfaces, back-end algorithms, and end-to-end product experiences. You'll own and optimize the entire product lifecycle, partnering closely with stakeholders to ensure we're nailing learner needs.

If you're energized by leveraging generative AI breakthroughs to tangibly level up learning for thousands of students and unafraid to challenge educational norms in the process, this is your frontier. Bring your A-game in full-stack development, AI acumen, and agile leadership - and let's reshape education for the AI era, one innovative application at a time.

For more information on 2 Hour Learning, visit our website [https://2hourlearning.com/] and the Future of Education Instagram page [https://www.instagram.com/futureof_education/]. To see a school built around 2 Hour Learning, check out Alpha [https://alpha.school/].

What You Will Be Doing

Architecting and coding interactive full stack web applications that harness advanced AI to enable personalized, accelerated learning
Continually experimenting with and integrating the latest generative AI tech to pioneer novel educational experiences
Owning end-to-end product lifecycle, from gathering requirements to development, launch and iterative enhancement
Partnering with stakeholders to align development with learner needs and garner insights to fuel cycles of innovation
Leveraging AI-driven automation across testing, debugging and beyond to maximize development velocity and robustness

What You Won’t Be Doing

Coding narrow AI features in isolation of overarching product goals and learner needs
Implementing AI in a superficial, ""buzzwordy"" way that doesn't drive material learning gains
Toiling away at small-scale internal demos; your applications will drive learning impact for thousands
Waiting for others to define product requirements or conduct user research; you'll lead the charge
Wasting hours on manual QA; you'll leverage AI-powered testing to maximize efficiency

Artificial Intelligence Engineer Key Responsibilities

Develop and deliver engaging, human-centered AI applications that demonstrably accelerate learning outcomes and efficiency for thousands of K-12 students.

Basic Requirements

3+ years full stack development experience with frameworks like React, Angular, Node.js, Django, etc.
Extensive experience leveraging large language models (LLMs) like GPT-4, Claude or Codex
Proven track record successfully managing the full product lifecycle, including research, requirement gathering, design, development, launch, and feedback gathering
Hands-on experience with large language models (LLMs) such as ChatGPT, Copilot, Gemini, or Claude, integrating these AI solutions into web applications
Outstanding communication skills to champion ideas and interact with users
Passion for pushing the boundaries of generative AI to revolutionize how the world learns

About 2 Hour Learning

2hr Learning is powered by AI technology that enables schools to provide personalized, mastery learning to students, enabling them to learn faster than standard school, thereby freeing up the rest of the school day to pursue their passions and interests.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:

You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Important! If you do not receive an email from us:

First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

Crossover Job Code: LJ-5361-SE-Stockhol-ArtificialInte"

Title:
AI Software Engineer
AI Software Engineer with verification
Job Description:
"About the job
At Infobip, we dream big. We value creativity, persistence, and innovation, passionately believing that it is through teamwork that we can all reach greater heights.

Since 2006, we have been innovating at the edge of technological possibilities and are now shaping global communications of the future. Through 70+ offices on six continents, Infobip’s platform is used by almost 70% of the population, making it the largest network of its kind and the only full-stack cloud communication platform globally.

Join us on our mission to create life-changing interactions between humans and online services with new and unseen solutions.

Why is this role important at Infobip?

Being a part of Infobip Engineering Powerhouse means working on an in-house developed product and delivering solutions on a global level. As an AI Software Engineer, you will play a key part in developing, deploying, and maintaining advanced AI models and solutions in our communication platform, and be involved in both the research and practical aspects of cutting-edge projects.

What will you do at Infobip? 

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and deploy AI models and solutions.
Develop and maintain software applications using Python.
Deploy and maintain containerized applications.
Research and develop new machine-learning-based solutions, capable of processing data in real time.
Work on state-of-the-art AI models.
Mentor and guide junior AI engineers.
Work within the agile framework in close collaboration with Product Management.
Participate with your team in agile practices such as backlog refinement and task prioritization.
Expand and improve your knowledge and be a part of the engineering community.

Qualifications

2+ years of relevant experience in fields such as AI/ML Engineering or Data Science
Problem-solving skills in relevant fields (e.g. in mathematics, optimization algorithms)
Strong programming skills and familiarity with basic data structures/algorithms
Solid understanding of AI and ML concepts.
Experience working with AI/ML models in a production environment.

Nice To Have Qualifications

Experience in Docker and maintaining production-stable containerized applications.
Proficiency in at least one Python web framework (e.g. FastAPI, Flask, Django).
Knowledge of networking protocols.
Experience in Digital Signal Processing.
Any work related to an academic background (teaching, research).
Desire for contributing to academia and collaboration with universities.

If you are passionate about artificial intelligence, thrive in a collaborative environment, and are excited about contributing to innovative projects, we would love to hear from you!

When you become a part of Infobip you can expect:

Awesome clients – We serve and partner with the majority of the leading mobile operators, OTTs, brands, banks, social networks, aggregators and many more. Seriously, our clients are really cool. Work with the world’s leading companies and impact how they communicate with their users!

Opportunity knocks. Often. – Being a part of a growing company in a growing industry – we challenge you not to grow! Whether it’s horizontal, vertical, or angular, we want to support the path that you want to carve.

Learn as you grow – Starting with a fantastic onboarding program, to internal education, education resources, e-learning to external educations, we invest heavily in employee learning and development.

Connect globally – Work with people from all over the world. We put the “global” in globalization.

Pay & Perks – Competitive salary, a team taking care of all the equipment you need, team building and other organized activities ...

Talk about a balanced lifestyle!

Infobip employees are people with diverse backgrounds, characteristics, and experiences that share the same passion and talent that helps us achieve our mission. That's why Infobip is committed to creating a diverse workplace and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status, or any other part of one's identity."
